users.models module

class users.models.User(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: AbstractUser

Custom User model for readers, journalists and editors.

Fields:

  • username: None, email will become username and used for login.

  • role: EmailField, users email address.

  • first_name: CharField, a users first name.

  • last_name: CharField, a users last name.

  • display_name: CharfField, a uses choosen display name, will be used as name when leaving comments.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

REQUIRED_FIELDS = ['first_name', 'last_name']
ROLE_CHOICES = [('reader', 'Reader'), ('journalist', 'Journalist'), ('editor', 'Editor')]
USERNAME_FIELD = 'email'
articles

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

auth_token

Accessor to the related object on the reverse side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Place.restaurant is a ReverseOneToOneDescriptor instance.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

username = None
class users.models.UserManager(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: BaseUserManager

Manager for CustomUser model.

Provides helper methods to create regular users and superusers with email as the unique identifier instead of username.

  • param: BaseUserManager, provides Django’s base user management methods.

  • return: custom user manager for the User model.

create_superuser(email, password=None, **extra_fields)[source]

Creates and saves a superuser admin with full access.

  • param: email, admin’s email address.

  • param: password, admin’s password.

  • param: **extra_fields, optional extra attributes for the user.

  • return: created superuser instance.

create_user(email, password=None, **extra_fields)[source]

Creates and saves a regular user with the given email and password.

  • param: email, user’s email address (required).

  • param: password, user’s chosen password.

  • param: **extra_fields, additional fields to set on the user.

  • return: created user instance.

use_in_migrations = True

If set to True the manager will be serialized into migrations and will thus be available in e.g. RunPython operations.

users.signals module

users.signals.assign_user_group(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]

Assigns users to the correct group, after checking that the group alreadys exists.

users.signals.setup_default_groups()[source]

Ensures that the user groups and permissions exist.

users.tests module

class users.tests.ReaderFlowTests(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TestCase

Tests reader dashboard functionality, including subscription listings and unsubscribe functionality.

setUp()[source]

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

test_dashboard_pagination_works()[source]

Dashboard should correctly paginate long subscription lists.

test_dashboard_requires_login()[source]

Unauthenticated users should be redirected to login page.

test_reader_can_unsubscribe_from_journalist()[source]

Reader should be able to unsubscribe from a journalist.

test_reader_can_unsubscribe_from_publication()[source]

Reader should be able to unsubscribe from a publication.

test_reader_dashboard_loads_with_subscriptions()[source]

Reader dashboard should display both types of subscriptions.

class users.views.CustomLoginView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: LoginView

Custom login for all users.

  • param: LoginView, provides built-in authentication functionality.

  • return: renders login page and handles authentication.

Gets the login form.

  • param: form_class, optional form class to use.

  • return: form instance with updated widget attributes.

template_name = 'users/login.html'
class users.views.CustomLogoutView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: LogoutView

Custom logout view.

  • param: LogoutView, provides built-in logout functionality.

  • return: redirects to the home page after logout.

dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Add logout confirmation message before redirecting.

  • param: request, the current HTTP request.

  • param: *args, positional arguments.

  • param: **kwargs, keyword arguments.

  • return: response redirecting to the next page after logout.

next_page = '/'
class users.views.ProfileView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: LoginRequiredMixin, TemplateView

Displays a user’s profile page.

Readers have limited content shown. Journalists see their articles. Editors see their managed publications.

  • param: LoginRequiredMixin, ensures the user is authenticated.

  • param: TemplateView, provides template rendering.

  • return: renders user profile with personalized content.

get_context_data(**kwargs)[source]

Add user-specific data to the profile page.

  • For journalists: includes their articles.

  • For editors: includes publications they manage.

  • param: **kwargs, additional context arguments.

  • return: context dictionary with user-specific content.

template_name = 'users/profile.html'
class users.views.ReaderDashboardView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: LoginRequiredMixin, PaginationMixin, TemplateView

Displays the reader’s dashboard. Shows and allows management of their active subscriptions to publications and journalists.

  • param: LoginRequiredMixin, ensures the user is logged in.

  • param: PaginationMixin, enables pagination for subscriptions.

  • param: TemplateView, provides dashboard rendering.

  • return: renders the reader dashboard page.

get_context_data(**kwargs)[source]

Add paginated publication and journalist subscriptions to the context.

  • Splits pagination between publications and journalists.

  • param: **kwargs, additional context arguments.

  • return: dictionary with subscription data and pagination objects.

paginate_by = 10
template_name = 'users/reader_dashboard.html'
class users.views.SignUpEditorView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: CreateView

Handles registration for editor accounts.

Assigns the editor role to new users.

  • param: CreateView, provides user creation form and logic.

  • return: redirects to home page upon successful registration.

  • return: redirects to home page upon successful registration.

  • param: form, validated user registration form.

  • return: redirect to home page.

  • param: form_class, optional form class to use.

  • return: form instance with updated widget attributes.

model

alias of User

success_url = '/'
template_name = 'users/signup_reader.html'
users.views.editor_profile(request, editor_id)[source]

Displays the public profile of an editor.

Shows all publications managed by the editor.

  • param: request, the current HTTP request.

  • param: editor_id, the ID of the editor to display.

  • return: rendered editor profile template with publications and articles.

users.views.journalist_profile(request, journalist_id)[source]

Displays the public profile of a journalist.

Shows all published articles authored by the journalist, lists all publications they have written forand indicates whether the current reader is subscribed to this journalist.

  • param: request, the current HTTP request.

  • param: journalist_id, the ID of the journalist to display.

  • return: rendered journalist profile template with articles and subscription info.

users.views.reader_profile(request)[source]

Displays the reader’s profile page.

Shows their active subscriptions to publications and journalists.

  • param: request, the current HTTP request.

  • return: rendered reader profile template with subscription data.
